    • Method Detail

      • isPresent

        public static boolean isPresent(java.lang.String stringToCheck)
        Checks to see whether input string is empty or not. Returns false if length of String is 0 or a NullPointerException occurs (e.g. for newly intialised String arrays java). Otherwise true is returned. Note: this presence check views a String with a (or any) single space(s) in it as a non-empty input and returns true for it.
        Parameters:
        stringToCheck - the string to be checked
        Returns:
        returns false if the String is empty (i.e. has a length of 0, using the .length() command or triggers a NullPointerException caused by String arrays that have been initialised but have no value assigned to them) and true if the string is not empty

      • isAppropriateLength

        public static boolean isAppropriateLength(int maxLengthAllowed,
                                          java.lang.String stringToCheck)
        Checks to see if String is of desired length. If String is less than or equal to desired length, true is returned. Otherwise, false is returned.
        Parameters:
        maxLengthAllowed - the maximum length of the string
        stringToCheck - the string to perform the length check on
        Returns:
        returns true if the length of the string is less than or equal to the max length allowed and false if not.

      • formatCheckDateOfBirth

        public static boolean formatCheckDateOfBirth(java.lang.String stringToCheck)
        A simple format check to see whether a string is in the form dd/mm/yyyy.It checks to see that there are integers and dashes in the correct places. It also checks to see if the month field is greater than twelve and if the day field is greater than 31 (although invalid inputs can occur, for example if the day is 31 and the month is february. If a valid date is not entered, false is returned.
        Parameters:
        stringToCheck - the string to check
        Returns:
        true if the inputted string is considered a valid date in the form dd/mm/yyyy.

      • isInteger

        public static boolean isInteger(java.lang.String stringToCheck)
        Tries converting the input string into an integer using the Integer.parseInt(). If a NumberFormatException is thrown, it is not an integer and false is returned, else true is returned.
        Parameters:
        stringToCheck - the string to check
        Returns:
        true is returned if the string is an integer, false is returned if the string is not an integer

      • rangeCheck

        public static boolean rangeCheck(int lowerLimitInclusice,
                                 int upperLimitInclusive,
                                 int integerToCheck)
        Checks to see if the integer to check is with in the range specified. True is returned if in the range, else false
        Parameters:
        lowerLimitInclusice - this is the lower integer limit for range. Checks to see if integerToCheck is greater than OR equal to this number
        upperLimitInclusive - this is the upper integer limit for range. Checks to see if integerToCheck is less than OR equal to this number
        integerToCheck - the integer number to see if it is with in the specified range
        Returns:
        True is returned if integerToCheck is greater than or equal to lowerLimitInclusive AND if integerToCheck is less than or equal to upperLimitInclusive. Otherwise, false is returned

      • lookUpCheck

        public static boolean lookUpCheck(java.lang.String[] acceptableInputs,
                                  java.lang.String stringToCheck)
        Performs a linear search through all acceptable inputs comparing it to the String input. If a match is found, true is returned, else false is returned.
        Parameters:
        acceptableInputs - A String array containing all acceptable inputs
        stringToCheck - The String to check against the acceptable inputs
        Returns:
        True is returned if stringToCheck matches any item in the array, otherwise false is returned.

      • isCorrectLength

        public static boolean isCorrectLength(int correctLength,
                                      java.lang.String stringToCheck)
        Checks to see if the length of the string is equal to the desired length.
        Parameters:
        correctLength - The desired length of the string
        stringToCheck - the string to have its length checked
        Returns:
        True is returned if the length of the string equals correctLength, else false.

      • isgreaterThanOrEqual

        public static boolean isgreaterThanOrEqual(int numberThatIntegerShouldBeGreaterThanOrEqual,
                                           int numberToCheck)
        Checks whether an integer is greater than or equal to another integer
        Parameters:
        numberThatIntegerShouldBeGreaterThanOrEqual - The value that numberToCheck should be greater than or equal to in order to return true
        numberToCheck - The number that is being checked to see if it is greater than or equal to numberThatIntegerShouldBeGreaterThanOrEqual
        Returns:
        True is returned if numberToCheck is greater than or equal to numberThatIntegerShouldBeGreaterThanOrEqual, otherwise false is returned

      • containsIllegalStrings

        public static boolean containsIllegalStrings(java.lang.String itemToCheck)
        Checks the string to see if it contains any of strings that are not allowed. For example, if commas are used to separate items, commas may be banned.
        Parameters:
        itemToCheck - The string to check
        Returns:
        true is returned if it contains any illegal characters / strings. Otherwise, false is returned.

      • getListOfIllegalStrings

        public static java.lang.String getListOfIllegalStrings()
        Returns all illegal character sequences as a string
        Returns:
        The illegal characters sequence as a presentable string

      • consistsOnlyOfLetters

        public static boolean consistsOnlyOfLetters(java.lang.String stringToCheck)
        Checks to see whether the string only contains characters from the English alphabet.
        Parameters:
        stringToCheck - The string to be checked
        Returns:
        True is returned if the string consists only of letters in the English alphabet. Otherwise, false is returned.

      • isValidPostcode

        public static boolean isValidPostcode(java.lang.String postCode)
        Checks to see if the postcode is valid.
        Parameters:
        postCode - The postcode as a string
        Returns:
        True is returned if the postcode is between 6 and 8 characters, contains exactly one space and all characters other than a space character are capitalised.

      • onlyContainsPhoneNumberCharacters

        public static boolean onlyContainsPhoneNumberCharacters(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
        Checks if the string only contains +, spaces and numbers.
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber - The phone number
        Returns:
        True is returned if the string consists only of plusses, spaces and digits. Otehrwise, false is returned.
